item.title: After the release of ADP and GDP data in the United States, the probability of the Federal Reserve keeping interest rates unchanged in September has increased.
item.description: On July 30th, according to CME's "FedWatch": There is a 97.9% probability that the Fed will keep rates unchanged in July (which is consistent with the pre-data release situation), and a 2.1% probability of a 25-basis-point rate cut.The probability of the Fed keeping rates unchanged in September is 37.9% (before the release of U.S. ADP and GDP data, it was 34%). The cumulative probability of a 25-basis-point rate cut is 60.9%, and the cumulative probability of a 50-basis-point rate cut is 1.3%. (FXStreet)

item.title: JPMorgan Chase Partners with Coinbase to Make It Easier for Customers to Buy Cryptocurrency
item.description: On July 30th, the crypto reporter Eleanor Terrett disclosed that JPMorgan Chase is currently working in collaboration with Coinbase to enable Chase customers to purchase cryptocurrency more conveniently. Shortly, Chase customers will be able to utilize their Chase credit cards to top up their Coinbase accounts. By 2026, direct bank transfers to cryptocurrency wallets will also be supported, along with the capability to redeem Chase Ultimate Rewards points for cryptocurrency on a 1:1 basis, making it the first rewards program to permit the use of major bank points to purchase cryptocurrency.

item.title: Analysis: US Second Quarter Data Severely Distorted, Weak Economic Growth Expected to Continue in the Second Half of the Year
item.description: July 30th: An institutional analysis indicated that, similar to the first quarter, the major GDP data in the second quarter was significantly distorted by trade. Economists advocated focusing on final sales to domestic private buyers. This is regarded by economists and policymakers as a key indicator of U.S. economic growth. After a 1.9% growth in the first quarter, this indicator grew by 1.2% in the second quarter.This was the slowest domestic demand growth since the fourth quarter of 2022. Additionally, economists are anticipating weak economic growth in the second half of the year. Although the White House announced a series of trade agreements, economists stated that the actual tariff rate in the U.S. still remains one of the highest levels since the 1930s. It is noted that about 60% of U.S. imports are still not affected by the agreements. (Jinshi)

item.title: Pendle is now officially live on HyperEVM
item.description: On July 30th, Pendle announced in a blog post that it has now become live on HyperEVM. This will bring Pendle's fixed income infrastructure to HyperEVM users. As part of the launch, the following pools have been introduced:? Hyperbeat USDT (maturating on December 18, 2025)? Hyperbeat Ultra Hype (maturating on December 18, 2025)? Hyperbeat beHYPE Reserve Pool (maturating on October 30, 2025)? Kinetiq kHype (maturating on November 13, 2025)As a special benefit from Pendle, Hyperbeat has further allocated 500,000 Hearts to each of the three aforementioned Hyperbeat pools (a total of 1.5 million Hearts), which will be distributed proportionally before the pools' maturity. This is an additional reward on top of the Hearts/points/yield that has already been received.

item.title: Bitcoin Ecosystem Smart Contract Infrastructure Midl Completes $2.4 Million Seed Round, Led by Draper Associates
item.description: On July 30th, in Midl, the smart contract infrastructure of the Bitcoin ecosystem, it was announced that the $2.4 million seed round of financing had been completed. This round of financing was led by Draper Associates, and Draper Dragon, a venture capital fund, also participated.The new funds are planned to support the development of a native smart contract execution environment on the Bitcoin mainnet. The project is currently in the testnet stage, and the mainnet is expected to be launched soon.

item.title: Trump: Fed Must Cut Rates, Q2 GDP Much Better Than Expected
item.description: On July 30th, U.S. President Trump declared that the Fed is obligated to cut interest rates. The second-quarter GDP has just been made public, which is significantly better than anticipated. (Xinhua News Agency)

item.title: Publicly traded company Profusa has invested $1 million to purchase Bitcoin
item.description: On July 30th, the Nasdaq-listed company Profusa announced that, in line with its previously disclosed cryptocurrency treasury strategy, the company has allocated one million dollars to purchase Bitcoin. The company indicated that it intends to continuously utilize the advantages of Bitcoin-centric digital assets to hedge against macroeconomic uncertainties.

item.title: Amber Group Allegedly Riding the HYPE Wave, Position Floating PNL at $6.47 Million
item.description: On July 30th, according to on-chain analyst AI Auntie, Amber Group appears to be constantly engaging in the practice of buying low and selling high HYPE:Address 0x4E4...4Df6e received 81,521 HYPE tokens worth $3.46 million 20 minutes ago;Address 0xcfd...efff4 still holds $10.7 million worth of HYPE in the spot market (251,000 tokens) with an average price of $16.967, and currently has unrealized gains of $6.47 million.

item.title: The US second-quarter economic rebound exceeded expectations, but the overall trend still shows a slight slowdown.
item.description: July 30th: During the second quarter, the U.S. GDP growth outperformed expectations and rebounded from the earlier decline that was caused by trade conflicts at the beginning of the year. Nevertheless, despite this, the overall trend of economic growth still demonstrated a slight deceleration when compared to the lower levels of recent years. The data indicates that, after excluding inflation, the initial estimation of the U.S. second-quarter real GDP annualized growth was 3%, surpassing expectations.Compared to the -0.5% in the first quarter, the growth in the second quarter witnessed a significant rebound. At the start of the year, U.S. businesses imported a substantial amount of goods in advance in order to avoid President Trump's tariff increase policy, resulting in a sharp rise in imports in the first quarter, which significantly pulled down the GDP growth of that quarter.However, in the subsequent three months, this trend has undergone a reversal. President Trump's aggressive

item.title: The Dollar Index (DXY) has risen over 10 points in the short term, reaching 99.24.
item.description: On July 30th, the US Dollar Index (DXY) saw a short-term increase of more than 10 points and reached 99.24. The Euro to US Dollar (EUR/USD) dropped below 1.15, with an intraday decline of 0.38%. (FXStreet)
